In reality, the maneuver essentially means that all of the Dem on the committee voted against the bill.
To clarify, the committee voted down the bill using a procedure in which members are not forced to give a direct yes or no vote.
basic gist- the committee questioned if parental choice is effective - and the bill died in committee
committee is pushing amendments that were rejected in policy committee
Sen Romero - this opportunity for parents - our kids first teachers. the bill helps low-income and minority parents
Sen Huff - leg council says DOC kids will have to return to district of residence
ASM Coto wants to know why Rowland opposes - Sen Huff responded
ASM Hall - adds that DOC cripples the districts kids are leaving
ASM Hall says he strongly opposes the bill - says it's the beginning to the end of public instruction
ASM Davis is expressing concern about a lack of evaluation
ASM Harkey is asking why amendments are being added in the appropriations committee
amendment would deny DOC to 2 million kids - about 1/3 of students in the state
Sen Romero- committee is asking for amendments that would strangle the bill by allowing districts of residence veto power
Lucia again clarrified that the bill actually save the state money
Calderon says he tends to support DOC, but doesn't want to move forward blindfolded. says it's not the time to expand programs
Asm de Leon argued the bill expands the program to every district in the state
Asm Calderon says the committee is being asked to expand a program that we don't know is successful
explanation of how some suggested committee amendments would really deny parents choice
Senator Romero is explaining the difference between DOC and interdistrict transfer
ASM Strickland is asking how we could not renew this for our kids and expressing her strong support.
ASM de Leon is emphasizing the need to study DOC
no witnesses in opposition- moving on to questions from members
Bill Lucia is explaining how SB 680 actually will save the state money
Asm de Leon has asked Sen Huff to wrap testimony
Asm de leon has asked for clarification of the random public drawing to let kids in - Bill Lucia from EdVoice clarified where it appears
senator Huff is explaining how the program has been successful for 16 yrs and that D0Cs are open to all kids
senator's Huff + Romero are making the case for SB 680
the approps hearing is set to start in 10 min. some times things in the capitol move quickly.
it's time to protect DOC
